articles.author: Nandita Bose, Jarrett Renshaw, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris wasted no time launching her 2024 presidential campaign, seeking the support of fellow Democrats with the backing of President Joe Biden after he pulled out of the race amid concerns about his age and health.
articles.title: Backed by Biden, Harris moves to lock up White House bid

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli tank shelling and airstrikes killed at least 16 Palestinians near Khan Younis, Gaza medics said on Monday, after Israel issued new orders to evacuate some neighbourhoods following what it said were renewed attacks from those areas.
articles.title: Israel issues evacuation orders in south Gaza, kills 16 Palestinians

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Iraq wants troops from a U.S.-led military coalition to begin withdrawing in September and to formally end the coalition's work by September 2025, four Iraqi sources said, with some U.S. forces likely to remain in a newly negotiated advisory capacity.
articles.title: Iraq eyes drawdown of US-led forces starting September, sources say

articles.author: Sam Jahan, Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: Bangladesh appeared calm on Monday amid a curfew, but widespread disruption of telecoms prevailed a day after the Supreme Court scrapped some quotas for government jobs that sparked protests this month that killed scores.
articles.title: Bangladesh calm a day after top court scrapped some job quotas

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: U.S. Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle admitted to Congress on Monday that she and her agency failed when a would-be assassin wounded Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump at a July 13 campaign rally in Pennsylvania this week.
articles.title: US Secret Service director on Trump shooting: 'We failed'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of people ordered from their homes in the face of a raging wildfire in a remote corner of eastern Canada can return home this week as the risk to their community diminished, authorities said over the weekend.
articles.title: Residents of eastern Canadian community menaced by wildfire can return home

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A Kentucky man was arrested and charged with a federal hate crime for threatening a Palestinian American man with a loaded gun, the U.S. Justice Department said on Monday, in a step welcomed by advocates documenting rising Islamophobia.
articles.title: Kentucky man charged with federal hate crime for threats to Palestinian American

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's southern region of Belgorod is restricting entry from Tuesday to 14 areas on the border with Ukraine that are subject to heavy attack from Kyiv's forces, measures that appeared to be part of a Kremlin strategy to set up a border buffer zone.
articles.title: Russia restricts entry to border areas in southern Belgorod region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gunman entered a nursing home in northwestern Croatia on Monday shooting dead five people, including his mother, and injuring six others, a government minister said.
articles.title: Gunman kills six in Croatia nursing home shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 50 bodies were pulled from the mud on Monday following two landslides in southern Ethiopia, a local official said.
articles.title: At least 50 bodies pulled from mud after southern Ethiopia landslide
